info.title: Party Management - Individual
info.description:
This API manages the individual resource. The API enables to create, delete, and modify individual

###### Compliant with TMF632_Party_Management_API_REST_Specification_R14.5.1

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Query parameter to specify the search filters. Attribute filters are specified in the following way:
_?filters=([attributeName][operator][value],\u2026,[value])[&|;]\u2026[&|;]([attributeName][operator][value],\u2026,[value])_

Supported operators are:
* Equality: == (equals), != (not equals)
* Contains: =@ (contains), !@ (does not contain)
* Less than: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to)
* Greater than: > (greater than),  >= (greater than or equal to)
* RegExp: =~ (match), !~ (does not match)

Comma separated values for an attribute are evaluated with OR operator. & is the separator for multiple queries to be evaluated with AND operator while the ; is the separator for multiple queries to be evaluated with OR operator.

400.description: *Bad Request* -  The server cannot process the request due to malformed syntax. The response can be caused by missing mandatory query parameters, invalid value in the query parameters, validation exceptions, and so on.

409.description: *Conflict* - The server cannot complete the request due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

500.description: *Internal Server Error* - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

502.description: *Bad Gateway* - The server encountered an unexpected condition when calling another service.

503.description: *Service Unavailable* - The server cannot fulfill the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server. Retry later.

get.summary: Retrieve individuals based on given filters
get.description:
This operation provides an ability to filter individual based on different criteria.
**Supported Filters:**
 - relatedParty.id == '< value >'
 **Supported Sort:**
 - none
 
Note : Pagination is not supported by this operation

400.description: *Bad Request* -  The server cannot process the request due to malformed syntax. The response can be caused by missing mandatory query parameters, invalid value in the query parameters, validation exceptions, and so on.

409.description: *Conflict* - The server cannot complete the request due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

500.description: *Internal Server Error* - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

502.description: *Bad Gateway* - The server encountered an unexpected condition when calling another service.

503.description: *Service Unavailable* - The server cannot fulfill the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server. Retry later.

post.description:
This operation creates an individual
###### TMF Open API compliant
**Mandatory:**
  - givenName
  - familyName
  
  At sub entity level following fields are mandatory
  
  - individualIdentification
      - identificationId
      - type
      
  - characteristic
    - name
    - value
    
  - externalReference
     - type
     - socialId
     - userName
  
  - relatedParty
     - id
     - role
  - contactMedium.type="email"
    - contactMedium.medium.type
    - contactMedium.medium.emailAddress
  - contactMedium.type="telephone"
    - medium.type
    - medium.number
  - contactMedium.type="postal address" (configurable)
    if address is provided as formatted address then following fields are mandatory
    - medium.type
    - medium.characteristic.type
    - medium.street1
    - medium.postCode
    - medium.country
    if address is provided as identifier then following fields are mandatory
    - medium.type
    - medium.characteristic.type
    - medium.characteristic.place.id
    - medium.characteristic.place.@referredType (GeographicAddress is supported)
    
 - profilePicture
    - id
 - InfluenceScore
    - Score
 - otherName
    - givenName
    - familyName
    - Third Level
 - Identification.Attachment
    - id


**Readonly:**
  - id
  - href

**Business rules:**

- Individual uniqueness
  The uniquness of Individual is based on following fields
  
    - identification.identificationId and indentification.type
    - externalReference.type and externalReference.socialId

  This operation will not allow duplicate individual to be created based on the above criteria
          
**Reference value:**
  - contactMedium.type (PartyManagementRefData:contactMediumType)
  - contactMedium.status (PartyManagementRefData:contactMediumStatus)
  - externalReference.type (PartyManagementRefData:externalReferenceType)
  - gender (PartyManagementRefData:gender)
  - identification.type (PartyManagementRefData:identificationType)
  - status (PartyManagementRefData:individualStatus)
  - issuingAuthority (PartyManagementRefData:issuingAuthority)
  - maritalStatus (PartyManagementRefData:maritalStatus)
  - medium.type (PartyManagementRefData:mediumType)
  - relatedParty.role (PartyManagementRefData:relatedPartyRole)
  - relatedParty.type (PartyManagementRefData:relatedPartyType)
  - residencyType (PartyManagementRefData:residencyType)
  - title (PartyManagementRefData:title)          

**Default behaviour:**

parameters.name: additionalAttributes
parameters.description: Check Completeness of individual on basis of configured decisions

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The subset of attributes which are expected in the response.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
The If-Match HTTP request header makes the request conditional. 
For GET and HEAD methods, the server will send back the requested resource only if it matches one of the listed ETags. 
For PUT and other non-safe methods, it will only upload the resource in this case

patch.description:
This operation allows partial update to individual resource.

**Patchable elements:**
- middleName                 ( replace,remove )
- familyName              ( replace,remove )
- preferredGivenName ( replace,remove )
- birthDate                      ( replace,remove )
- countryOfBirth  ( replace,remove )
- deathDate          ( replace,remove )
- gender ( replace,remove )
- location                ( replace,remove )
- maritalStatus     ( replace,remove )
- nationality           ( replace,remove )
- placeOfBirth       ( replace,remove )
- status    ( replace,remove )
- residencyType  ( replace,remove )
- title        ( replace,remove )
- language              ( replace,remove )
- personRank        ( replace,remove )
- profileImageURL              ( replace,remove )
- characteristic     (add, replace,remove )
- characteristic (name,replace,remove )
- characteristic.value         ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium (add,replace,remove )
- contactMedium.preferred           ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.validFor              ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.validFor.startDateTime ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.validFor.endDateTime  ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic    ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.emailAddress       ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.number  ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.city           ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.country   ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.postCode ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.stateOrProvince  ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.street1    ( replace,remove )
- contactMedium.characteristic.street2    ( replace,remove )
- externalReference.characteristic               (add,replace, remove )
- externalReference          (add, replace, remove )
- externalReference.socialName  ( replace,remove )
- externalReference.avatar             ( replace,remove )
- identification     ( add,replace, remove )
- identification.primary    ( replace,remove )
- identification.issuingAuthority   ( replace,remove )
- identification.validTill     ( replace,remove )
- identification.attachment            (add, replace, remove )
- relatedParty       ( add, replace, remove )

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Query parameter to specify the search filters. Attribute filters are specified in the following way:
_?filters=([attributeName][operator][value],\u2026,[value])[&|;]\u2026[&|;]([attributeName][operator][value],\u2026,[value])_

Supported operators are:
* Equality: == (equals), != (not equals)
* Contains: =@ (contains), !@ (does not contain)
* Less than: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to)
* Greater than: > (greater than),  >= (greater than or equal to)
* RegExp: =~ (match), !~ (does not match)

Comma separated values for an attribute are evaluated with OR operator. & is the separator for multiple queries to be evaluated with AND operator while the ; is the separator for multiple queries to be evaluated with OR operator.

200.description: *OK* - The individual addresses were retrieved successfully.

400.description: *Bad Request* - The server cannot process the request due to a malformed syntax. The response can be caused by missing mandatory query parameters, invalid value in the query parameters, validation exceptions, and so on.

409.description: *Conflict* - The server cannot complete the request due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

422.description: *Unprocessable Entity* - The server understands the content type of the request entity, and the syntax of the request entity is correct, but was unable to process the contained instructions.

500.description: *Internal Server Error* - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

502.description: *Bad Gateway* - The server encountered an unexpected condition when calling another service.

default.description: *Internal Server Error* - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description:
This operation retrieves individual addresses based on the provided filter values.  

**Mandatory:**
- individualId  - unique identifier of the individual      

**Supported Filters :**

addressRole==<value>  -   Represents role of address. Following are fixed set of values which are supported.
  such as invoice,mailing,service,shipping.
type  == <value> - address type such as Home/Work etc. ( Either type or role can be give at a time )
place.@referredType == <value>  - PlaceRef.@referredType to search for within the individual
place.id == <value> - The value of PlaceRef.id to search for within the individual
place.subPlace.id == <value> - The value of SubPlaceRef.id to search for within the individual
place.subPlace.@referredType == <value> - The value of SubPlaceRef.@referredType to search for within the individual
 
**Business rules:**
  - Operation will iterate over individual entity in order to filter the postal addresses. The related entities such as FA/BA are not traversed for filtering.
  - The rules for matching address type are driven by ** AddressManagementRefData:addressRole **  reference list. For example if 'Home' address is configured to be allowed as 'Service' address then filter such as 'addressRole=Service' would include the 'Home' address in response.
    The address role reference list contains the configuration information.
  

**Reference Data values:**
- place.@referredType  (Configuration:allowedPlaceRefReferredType)
- place.subPlace.@referredType(Configuration:allowedSubPlaceRefReferredType)

**Default behaviour:**
- If filter attributes are not provided then operation will return all the postal addresses of the individual.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
The If-Match HTTP request header makes the request conditional. 
For GET and HEAD methods, the server will send back the requested resource only if it matches one of the listed ETags. 
For PUT and other non-safe methods, it will only upload the resource in this case

post.description:
This operation associates a postal address to individual with given role. 

**Mandatory:**
  if address is provided as formatted address then following fields are mandatory
    - type
    - street1
    - postCode
    - country
  if address is provided as identifier then following fields are mandatory
    - type
    - place.id
    - place.@referredType (GeographicAddress is supported)
    
**Business rules:**

- The operation will validate the place.id, place.subplace.id

- Operation will support values for some of the attributes as below 
    place.@referredType='GeographicAddress'
    place.subPlace.@referredType='GeographicSubAddress'

- The operation is idempotent and will result no change to Individual resource in case the address already exist on the individual with given type

- The operation will use the place.id and subplace.id for conversion from geographic address to formatted address.

**Reference value:**

 - type - PartyManagementRefData:postalAddress

formattedName.description: A formatted name useful for specific contexts for example Chinese,Japanese,Korean

fullName.description: Full Name flatten (first,middle and last name flatten)

location.description: Temporary current location of the individual (may be used if the individual has approved its sharing)

maritalStatus.description: Marital status of the individual ( Married,divorced etc.)

placeOfBirth.description: Place of the birth of the individual

status.description: Status of the individual (for example active/inactive/obsolete and so on)

residencyType.description: Type of residency such as rent,own

title.description: Used for title like Pr,Dr,Sir etc.

personRank.description: Degree of importance of the person to the service provider.

profileImageURL.description: Published url for profile picture of Individual

identification.description: Represents our registration of information used as proof of identity by an individual (Passport/national identity card/SSN etc.)

characteristic.description:
Describes the characteristics of individual such as individual hobbies,center of interest etc. Apart from storage and retrieval no operations such as filtering,sorting etc. will be supported.
No sensitive infomration should be stored in this attribute.

otherName.description: To keep track of other names for e.g old name of a woman before marriage , an artist name and so on

externalReference.description: To manage touch points external OTT identifiers for person (facebook,google+ etc.)

InfluenceScore.description: Social influence score of an individual

ExternalReference.description: To manage touch points external OTT identifiers for person (facebook,google+ etc.)

type.description: The name of the external system or social channel. eg. facebook, twitter, etc.

href.description: Hypertext reference to the user image

avatar.description: The URL of the social user image

socialName.description: The displayable name of the social channel account

socialId.description: The internal identifier from the social channel account

status.description: Status of social profile such as pending, verified, obsolete and so on

userName.description: The login name of the social channel account

InfluenceScore.description: Represents a social influence score of an individual

provider.description: Name of the social analytics score provider; e.g. Klout

score.description: Score of an individual as calculated by the provider

OtherName.description: To keep track of other names for e.g old name of a woman before marriage , an artist name etc.

title.description: Used for title like Pr,Dr,Sir etc

fullName.description: Full Name flatten (first,middle and last name flatten)

formattedName.description: A formatted name useful for specific contexts (Chinese,Japanese,Korean)

Characteristics.description:
Describes the characteristics of customer such as customer hobbies,center of interest etc.
It's recommended not to store any senstive information (such as PII) to be persisted here.

IndividualIdentification.description:
Represents our registration of information used as proof of identity by an individual (Passport/national identity card/SSN etc.).
The uniqueness of Individual is decided based on identificationId and type.

identificationId.description: Identification value like actual SSN , passport number and so on.

issuingAuthority.description: Issuing authority like state, federal etc.

type.description: Type of identification like SSN,Passport etc.

primary.description: Indicates whether this identification is primary among several ones

attachment.description: Manages attachments of an individual identification

additionalAttribute.description: Describes the expression evaluation  of individual such as individual name,hasPhone No etc.

ErrorResponse.description:
Response containing descriptive error text, error code
type: object

code.description: The code associated with the error

message.description: The message associated with the error

traceId.description: A unique trace identifier used to correlate an error returned to a client with the server

op.description: The operation associated with this patched resource part. Valid values are 'add' or 'remove' or 'replace'.

path.description: The path of this resource part within the patched resource. For example, '/note' or '/name' or '/orderItem/quantity'.

value.description: The value of the patched resource part

RelatedPartyRef.description: Contains reference to the related party.

id.description: Unique id of an existing party.

href.description: The self href for the existing related party.

type.description:
Describes if it's Customer/Individual/Organazation
Patchable - No

startDateTime.description: The time period start date and time.

endDateTime.description: The time period end date and time.

MediumCharacteristic.description: Medium information for customer(e.g. email address, mobile number,fax number).

emailAddress.description: The contact's email address for the ContactMedium type of email.

number.description: The contact's phone number for Contact Medium type telephone number.

city.description: The city name for the contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

country.description: The country ISO code for the contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

postCode.description: The postcode for the contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

stateOrProvince.description: The state or province from contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

street1.description: The first street line for the contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

street2.description: The second street line for the contact's address for Contact Medium type postal address.

PlaceRef.description: A place reference is a pointer to either GeographicAddress,GeographicSubAddress,GeographicLocation

id.description: Unique identifier of GeographicAddress,GeographicSite or GeographicLocation

@referredType.description: Describes the type of entity such as GeographicAddress, GeographicSite or GeographicLocation

SubPlaceRef.description: A subplace reference is a pointer to GeographicSubAddress

id.description: Unique identifier of entity such as GeographicSubAddress

@referredType.description: Describes the type of entity such as GeographicSubAddress

Error.description: Error response. This object is used when an API throws an error, typically with a HTTP error response codes 3xx, 4xx, and 5xx

code.description: Error code relevant to an application, defined in the API or in a common list

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error that can be displayed to a user

message.description: Additional information about the error  and corrective actions related to the error that can be displayed to a user

referenceError.description: URI of the documentation describing the error

traceId.description: Unique tracker ID that is used to facilitate the troubleshooting

characteristic.description: Charachteristic parameters that are associated with the error

ErrorCharacteristic.description: Parameter that is associated with the error entity

name.description: Non-localized name identifier of the characteristic

ValidationError.description: Validation error object that is used when an API throws an error, typically with a HTTP error response code 422

ValidationMessage.description: Message associated with the validation failure

id.description: Non-localized name identifier of the validation message

subtype.description: Distinct code which represents the issue

parameter.description: Name/value pair of the validation message

path.description: Path to the resource part to which the validation message is related

resource.description: Resource that is associated with the message

ValidationMessageParameter.description: Name/value pair of the validation message parameter

RelatedResource.description: Resource that is associated with the validation message (that is, triggered the validation failure)

containedResource.description: Other resources, specs, or offers that are linked to the message but did not trigger the validation message

Variable.description: Variable that is associated with a resource

ContainedResource.description: Resources that are contained in the validation message

variable.description: Variables that are related to the resource

ContactMedium.description: Contact medium associated to the customer (e.g. email address, telephone number etc).

type.description: Contact medium type like email address, telephone number, postal address.

preferred.description: Indicator for preferred contact medium for communication

AttachmentRef.description: Represents a reference to the associated attachment

id.description: Unique, auto-generated identifier of the associated attachment

name.description: The name of the attachment. Optional.

header-if-match.name: If-Match
header-if-match.description: entity tag for version of resource to update

query-filters.name: filters
query-filters.description: Filter criteria for query.Supported attribute Customer with operator '=='.
